text:
Sawaddee ka welcome to hot Thai kitchen today I'm 
going to go back to the basics and show you how to

make a Thai style chicken stock and I take Thai 
style because that does make a difference so say

you buy chicken stock and it's a Western brand but 
kind of aromatics and flavor that they have will

be different and it may not work especially in 
dishes where the stock is the main ingredient like

a Thai chicken noodle soup and yes that recipe is 
coming so stay tuned so today I'll show you how

you can make your own Thai style stock at home 
and you can use it anywhere I call for chicken

stock and it's super easy as you see what I do is 
I make a whole bunch I keep them in ziplock bags

in the freezer and I just pull it out whenever I 
need and I don't have to make it very often at all

so let's get started so in this pot here I've got 
some chicken bones now I buy chicken bones from a

Chinese butcher if you can't find chicken bones 
at your butcher what you can do is just collect

chicken bones as you use chicken so buy bone and 
chicken debone it to save the bones in the freezer

until you've got enough right now I have rinsed 
the bones and I also cut off any big chunks of

fat because that will just make my skimming job a 
little easier at the end so I'm going to add some

water to this I'm starting with cold water and I 
want to completely cover the chicken we're going

to turn this on and at this point I'm just going 
to crank it on high because I just need it to come

to a simmer once it's simmering I'm gonna turn 
the heat down I want to maintain a gentle simmer

for about 45 minutes to an hour all right so now 
that your house is starting to smell like chicken

soup you can see that there's a lot of scum and 
fat and foam and crutch floating to the top that

is your cue to go in with a fine mesh skimmer so 
just this one and what I love about this skimmer

is that it's actually fine enough that it also 
scoops up the fat and this is actually one of

my top five favorite tools in the kitchen and if 
you want to know what the other four are you can

check out the video where I ranked my favorite 
top I have small tools in the kitchen I'll put

the link in the description below so now that it 
looks cleaner we're going to add to the aromatics

and the aromatics are basically vegetables and 
herbs it's going to help at flavor subtle flavor

to the stock so what I've got here is some garlic 
some cilantro roots now if you don't have some

tree roots you can use a stems instead I've also 
got some daikon which is a classic vegetable for

stalks in Thailand I sometimes don't put it in 
because when you buy daikon at the source it's

like this massive thing and then I don't know 
what to do with the rest of it I often add onions

instead of daikon today I'm just going to add 
both just because I have it onion is not however

commonly added in Thai sauce but I find that it 
doesn't add too much of a flavor but it does add

a natural sweetness which I really like I've got 
some peppercorns so this is white peppercorns

that I just smashed until they're broken in 
my mortar and pestle adds a little heat and

this is the top of lemongrass so whenever you cook 
with lemongrass I say this all the time just use

the bottom half because the top doesn't have much 
flavor well I freeze the top and I saved them for

sauce because it adds a subtle subtle fresh aroma 
without making this tastes like a lemongrass soup

right so I always have a bag of them in my freezer 
so now that my stock is cleaner I'm going to add

all my vegetables all I want without splashing 
myself with hot soup hopefully always a challenge

okay and this is going to go for another hour or 
45 minutes as long as you get the total amount of

time to about 1 hour 45 minutes to 2 hours you're 
good to go and that's pretty much it how easy is

that oh that smell is so comforting it's like the 
smell of chicken soup and your stock is pretty

much done now at this point you can strain this 
whole thing through a colander or if you have one

of these big spiders you can just fish everything 
out there's actually quite a bit of meat still on

the chicken so sometimes I'll go through and I'll 
pick out the meat for me to be totally bland but

I'll throw it into like I don't know fried rice 
or something that's going to get seasons again if

you don't want to waste all that meat now this is 
an oversized skimmer which is the first time I'm

using it oh look at that now in terms of storage 
chicken sauce freezes really well and I really

recommend you freeze it in a ziploc freezer bag 
but make sure you don't overfill it just add it

so when it lays flat it's about you know half an 
inch thick it will make it so much easier for you

to use and it'll be quicker just saw and that is 
it now you've got beautiful chicken stocks which

you can use for so many different recipes and for 
some recipe ideas of what you can use a stop for

I'll put links to videos in the description box 
below also stay tuned for my chicken noodle soup

episode that's what I'm going to use this 
batch for and the full recipe as a way to

be on hot hsn.com and when you make it send me 
a photo of your chicken stock and you can send

that on Facebook Twitter or Instagram and I will 
see you next time for your next silly shift tiny
